intro: Aquilegia einseleana f. medunensis, commonly known as the Medunense Columbine, is a botanical variant of the European columbine. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers with five petals and prominent nectar guides. The plant is native to the Alps and thrives in moist, calcareous soils. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces compound leaves with three leaflets. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
